channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for OK
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for OK

item.title: Report E-2023090096
item.description:
Report E-2023090096

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-11T03:12:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-08
  • City: MUSKOGEE
  • State: OK
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ACTION RESOURCES, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 1
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Truck transporting tank trailer load of Nitric Acid was in transit when the driver noticed product leaking from the front portion of the tank onto the rear portion of the truck. Driver pulled over to the shoulder of the road to investigate. Driver discovered a small leak coming from the tank. 911 was called for assistance. The fire department responded and deployed the hazmat team. The roadway was shut down as a precaution. Enviromental response and remediation crew was dispatched to the scene to perform the cleanup, remediation and load transfer onto another tanker. The load was successfully transferred to another tanker and transported to the destination. The cleanup and remediation of the small spill have been completed. The driver accidentally inhaled some nitric fumes before donning his PPE while investigating the problem. He was transported to hospital for treatment. Driver was treated and released. Upon a full inspection of the tank, it was determined that there were some pits in the barrel that caused the leak.

item.title: Report X-2023081254
item.description:
Report X-2023081254

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-11T03:12:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-16
  • City: BROKEN ARROW
  • State: OK
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: package handlers saw the box was wet while unloading the trailer. they put the box in a hazmat tub and brought to qa. no damage to any other packages nor was the box leaking heavily. DescribePack: the lid/closure of the bottle was closed tightly, but there is still a gap for liquid to seep through. there is no hole, just a gap/crookedness to the lid. lid cannot be adjusted. this is a slow leak. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: package placed in damage tub, lid is messed up. placed in plastic hazmat bag.

DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The spill was immediately cleaned up, and placed in a hazardous material tote.

item.title: Report E-2023080885
item.description:
Report E-2023080885

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-05T15:12:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-10
  • City: ELGIN
  • State: OK
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: ON August 10,2023, one (1) 5-gallon pail of acetic acid was punctured by a forklift and released approximately all its contents to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from HazChem Environmental to remediate the site. HazChem personnel deployed granular absorbents to the release and worked them in using hand tools. All acetic acid-impacted material was containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2023080696
item.description:
Report E-2023080696

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-05T15:12:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-18
  • City: GLENPOOL
  • State: OK
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On August 18, 2023, at 0239 ET, XPO Logistics terminal LTU suffered a cargo related release of UN3149 “AcidiShine” to the trailer floor and asphalt lot below from a 55-gallon poly drum. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup. On August 18, 2023, at 0530 ET, contractors arrived onsite. Crew confirmed one 55-gallon poly drum of UN3149 “AcidiShine” released due to a pallet nail puncture. Approximately 30-gallons released to a 5’ x 30’ area of the trailer floor and a 10’ x 5’ area of the asphalt lot below. The impacted surfaces and debris were neutralized with a vinegar solution and confirmed neutral with pH test strips. Absorbents were then deployed and worked into the impacted areas. The empty damaged drum was containerized into an 85-gallon vented poly drum. All impacted absorbents and cleanup debris were collected into a 55-gallon vented poly drum. All waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2023080701
item.description:
Report E-2023080701

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-05T15:12:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-22
  • City: OKLAHOMA CITY
  • State: OK
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During off loading it was discovered that a release had occurred inside of one case of pH reducer (un1789) and that the caps were loose on two of the inner poly one gallon jugs and that 2 gallons of product had been released. Contractors were dispatched for the containment and cleanup of the release.
